publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Translated from the Latin of Dean Swift.

l.del: Lo, a vast Rock it's shapeless Fragment rears,

lg.l: And seems to bend beneath the load it bears;
Thro' middle air it's monstrous front extends,
And headlong o'er the frighten'd gulph impends.?Huge blackning waves it's fractur'd base surround
And grumbling bellow with an hollow sound;
The horrid noise dismays the realms of bliss,
And Neptune shrinks beneath his own Abyss.
Long had it brav'd the fury of the Main,
And Tempests had for ages roar'd in vain:
At length, the restless breaking of the wave,
Works thro' the stone, & forms a spacious Cave.
Now the props fail, the nodding Cliff gives way,
Projecting frightfull o'er the nether Sea.
Now the rocks tumble from the hideous steep,
Lash the wild waves, & shake the foaming Deep.
Astonish'd Travellers, believe from far
They view the relicks of the Gyant's War,
And Pelion in enormous fragments lye,
Crushing the proud Invaders of the Sky.
Sometimes the Surge, it's inmost entrails tears,
Within it's womb a frightfull void appears,
Expanding terrible from Sea to Sea,
It's double mouth wide op'ning to the Day.
Rocks rudely joyn'd, the wond'rous arches form,
(The future ruin of some mighty Storm)These once in dread array, stood
O'er the broad surface of the low'ring flood.High on its topmost arch, the harmless Doves
Build their soft nests, & woo their gentle Loves:
The sportive Seals, secure from tempests, place
Their oozy Beds beneath it's spreading base.But when bleak Winter rules the sickning Year,
And Clouds, & Storms with sullen Train appear;
Then strugling Winds, impatient of their chains,
With lawless rage usurp the watry Plains;
Surge over surge, in universal roar,
Bursts o'er the Cliff, & foams along the Shore:
Not, the loud crash of Ramparts tumbling down,
When Cannons thunder on some stubborn Town;
Not, Lightnings wing'd by Iove's avenging hand,
Pouring destruction on a guilty Land,
Can match the tumult of the boistrous Deep
Sonorous spuming at the craggy steep;
Sad presage of a Storm! from coast to coast
The noise rebounds, in circling echos tost.The Natives, tho' a dauntless hardy race,
Inur'd to all the horrors of the place,
To skip from rock to rock with nimble bound,
Hang on the brink, & dare the vast Profound,
Yet fly aghast this formidable Scene,
With hasty steps across the grassy plain.The Goats, which crop with unavailing toil,
The blasted herbage of the barren soil,?Snatch'd sudden by a washing billow, leave
Their darling lives beneath a watry grave.The trembling Fisher, doubtfull of the seas,
Safe to some creek his feeble bark conveys,
And hopeless to behold the Sky serene,
Wearies old Nereus with his Vows in vain.Z788101I
